content: Which painter, known for his post-impressionist style and works like "Starry Night" and "Sunflowers," famously cut off part of his own ear?

I believe the painter you're referring to is Vincent van Gogh. He is indeed famous for his post-impressionist artworks, including "Starry Night" and "Sunflowers." There is a well-known incident where he cut off a part of his own ear, which has become a symbol of his troubled life and mental health struggles.
